message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Pioglitazone is contraindicated in patients with a history of bladder cancer due to an increased risk of recurrence. Renal impairment is a warning and dosage adjustment may be needed, but it is not a contraindication. Genital mycotic infection and pancreatitis are adverse effects that may occur with pioglitazone use, but they are not contraindications.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Pioglitazone has been linked to an increased risk of bladder cancer, so a history of bladder cancer is a contraindication to its use. Renal impairment and genital mycotic infections are not contraindications to pioglitazone therapy, but caution should be exercised in patients with these conditions. Pancreatitis is a possible adverse effect of pioglitazone therapy but is not a contraindication.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Pioglitazone is contraindicated in patients with a history of bladder cancer due to possible tumor promotion. Renal impairment, genital mycotic infection, and pancreatitis are not contraindications for pioglitazone therapy.

Other contraindications include heart failure, liver disease, and pregnancy. Renal impairment, genital mycotic infection, and pancreatitis are not contraindications to pioglitazone therapy.
